welcome.no_domain_configured_description: You can create an internal OpenLDAP provider now, or set up a provider manually in {domainsAndUsers}.
welcome.account_provider_step_description: Use an existing account provider or create a new internal OpenLDAP on {node}. You can add or configure providers anytime in {domainsAndUsers}.
welcome.create_openldap_provider: Create an OpenLDAP account provider on node {node}
welcome.proxy_missing_on_node: NethVoice Proxy is not installed on this node
welcome.proxy_missing_on_node_description: NethVoice requires a proxy on the same node.
welcome.loading_data_next_steps: Loading data needed for the next steps...

proxy.address_and_iface_dont_match_message: For the devices in the PBX local network to work correctly, the 'Hairpin NAT' feature — also known as 'NAT reflection', 'NAT hairpinning', 'NAT on a stick' or 'Loopback NAT' — must be enabled on the firewall (specifically, on the device that manages the NAT of the public IP).
proxy.addresses_format: Must be in IPv4 address format
proxy.domain_helper: FQDN of the proxy. Must be a valid domain name
proxy.address_helper: IPv4 address expected to receive VoIP traffic
proxy.public_address_helper: Public IPV4 address expected to receive VoIP traffic, in case of NAT
proxy.address_tooltip: This is required only if it differs from @:welcome.proxy.network_interface address. The address is filled automatically based on the resolved FQDN above, but you can change it if needed.
proxy.proxy_already_configured: Proxy already configured on this node
proxy.proxy_already_configured_description: You can change these settings on the Settings page of the NethVoice Proxy application.
